entry.name: progressbar
entry.title: Progressbar Widget
entry.desc: Display status of a determinate or indeterminate process.

longdesc.p: The progress bar is designed to display the current percent complete for a process. The bar is coded to be flexibly sized through CSS and will scale to fit inside its parent container by default.

A determinate progress bar should only be used in situations where the system can accurately update the current status. A determinate progress bar should never fill from left to right, then loop back to empty for a single process — if the actual status cannot be calculated, an indeterminate progress bar should be used to provide user feedback.

option.name: max
option.desc: The maximum value of the progressbar.

type.name: Number
type.desc: A value between 0 and the max.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: Value can be set to false to create an indeterminate progressbar.

event.name: change
event.desc: Triggered when the value of the progressbar changes.

event.name: complete
event.desc: Triggered when the value of the progressbar reaches the maximum value.

method.name: value
method.desc: Gets or sets the current value of the progressbar.

signature.desc: Gets the current value of the progressbar.
Sets the current value of the progressbar.

argument.name: value
argument.desc: The value to set. See the value option for details on valid values.
